intro: Cremanthodium trilobum, commonly known as the three-lobed sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and sandy areas. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Cremanthodium trilobum is often found in open habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
